definition: to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)

sentences.english: This new novel is an absorbing saga.
sentences.chinese: 這部新小說是一怖引人入勝賭家世孝說。

sentences.english: And a provocative exhibition tries to unpick the myth about the world's most famous apeman .
sentences.chinese: 法國引人入勝的展覽欲揭開世界上最有名的猿人之謎。

sentences.english: A good book could interest readers at the beginning, and benefit readers in the end.
sentences.chinese: 一本好書能開卷引人入勝，終卷使人獲益非淺。

sentences.english: To me his new book doesn't appear to be as interesting as his others .
sentences.chinese: 在我看來他的新著沒有他的其他作品引人入勝。

sentences.english: I'll miss his hugely aspiring game. cloaked in that lazybones demeanor.
sentences.chinese: 我懷念在他慵懶的外表之下，引人入勝的比賽。

sentences.english: Such impressions must be entertainingly novel to the civilized person.
sentences.chinese: 這些印象對文明人說來，準是新奇得引人入勝的。

sentences.english: The very style of the book is fascinating.
sentences.chinese: 這本書的風格本身就會引人入勝。

sentences.english: But ina learning experience, you want a page-turner.
sentences.chinese: 但是在學習過程中，你需要創造引人入勝的體驗。

sentences.english: This new novel is an absorbing family saga.
sentences.chinese: 這部新小說是一部引人入勝的家世小說。

sentences.english: Mr Ramo's book is full of engaging vignettes like this.
sentences.chinese: 此類引人入勝的小故事在拉莫先生的書中比比皆是。

sentences.english: An equally intriguing possibility is that dark matter interacts with dark energy.
sentences.chinese: 同樣引人入勝的是暗物質有可能與暗能量相互影響。

sentences.english: Slender West Lake is the premier attraction in Yangzhou.
sentences.chinese: 瘦西湖是揚州最引人入勝之處。

sentences.english: Late thistles make spectacular purple accents.
sentences.chinese: 晚薊卻爭紫鬥豔，引人入勝。

sentences.english: Mr Lieven is no less gripping when he writes about the crucial issue of logistics.
sentences.chinese: 在寫到後勤的關鍵問題時，列文的敘述異常引人入勝。
這本書引人入勝，完全征服了讀者。

sentences.english: That is a good book which is opened with expectation and closed with profit.
sentences.chinese: 好書開卷引人入勝，閉卷使人得益。

definition: thought-provoking/worth thinking over/to provide food for thought
to arrange/to spread out/to narrate in detail/to describe at great length/to elaborate
shaking one to the core/extremely disturbing/hair-raising (idiom)
living spirit, living image (idiom); true to life/vivid and realistic
in different poses and with different expressions/in thousands of postures (idiom)
lit. slap the table and shout with praise (idiom); fig. wonderful!/amazing!/great!
to blend into one another/to blend together well
